title: (x) DIN-ish sans in Garden Design magazine redesign - Scene {Frank S}
content:
Garden Design magazine (US) recently redesigned and makes extensive use of this DIN-like sans. Distinctive characters include the g, the sloped legs of the M, high x-height, and the overall squareness.

Early hunches that didn’t pan out: Flama (Feliciano), CP Company (Fabrizio Schiavi), Metroflex (Garagefonts). And no, it’s not DIN or Conduit. ;)

(Apologies for the images — I don’t have a scanner handy.)

Thanks, and happy hunting!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113144439im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/gdn_dsgn1_5783.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113144439im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/gdn_dsgn2_5138.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113144439im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/gdn_dsgn3_5632.jpg)

 [‹ NIKE SB logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113144439/http:/www.typophile.com/node/30563 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Jetlag Travel Guides - Trade Gothic Cond {Mike Y} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113144439/http:/www.typophile.com/node/30600 "Go to next forum topic")
author: marcox

comments.content: Looks like Scene by Sebastian Lester for me.

Good catch, schnappi. I’m often asked for alternates to DIN and hadn’t thought of [Scene](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113144439/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=24&displayfontid=M.116815.0.0&fontRendererText=WINNERS+english). Great to have another in the tool chest.
